com.yantra.api.vas

Interface confirmWorkOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.VASApi, YIFApi

    public interface confirmWorkOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document confirmWorkOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The confirmWorkOrder API confirms a work order.

    • Method Detail

      • confirmWorkOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document confirmWorkOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                      org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                               throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                      java.rmi.RemoteException

        The confirmWorkOrder API confirms a work order.

        For a PS or DS work order, whenever Provided Service or Standalone Delivery Service line is complete or some quantity of the product line is delivered.

      • The DELIVER_ORDER transaction is executed on the order pipeline.
      • If all Provided/Standalone Delivery service lines are complete and all product lines are delivered, all future appointments on the work order that are not included in the input will automatically be cancelled and its associated resource pool consumptions will be removed while all past appointments will be completed. However if it is a single appointment work order, the appointment will be completed.
      • Delivery lines that are associated to product lines will be completed based on associated product line deliveries. Such delivery lines will not be marked as complete but the status of order lines to which they are associated will be moved to Delivered.

        Note: For the associated product line that contains tag-controlled item in a PS or DS work order, a shipment needs to be created and confirmed with specific tag information first before the work order can be confirmed.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None.

        Events Raised:
        Raised during the transaction CONFIRM_WORK_ORDER.

          ON_WORK_ORDER_COMPLETION:
            The API raises this event on successful execution of service. Specific to provided service work order.
            Data published - VAS_CONFIRM_WORK_ORDER.ON_WORK_ORDER_COMPLETION.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt

          ON_WORK_ORDER_EXECUTION_FAILURE:
            The API raises this event on failed attempt to execute the service. Specific to provided service work order.
            Data published - VAS_CONFIRM_WORK_ORDER.ON_WORK_ORDER_EXECUTION_FAILURE.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt

          ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE:
            This event is raised when an order release status is changed for the order.
            Data published - YFS_ORDER_CHANGE.ON_ORDER_RELEASE_STATUS_CHANGE.xml
            Key data - modifyOrder_dbd.txt
            Template Support:
            Yes
          ATTENTION_REQUIRED:
            The API raises this event when AttentionRequired is switched from No to Yes. Specific to provided service work order.
            Data published - VAS_CONFIRM_WORK_ORDER.ATTENTION_REQUIRED.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt

        See confirmWorkOrderActivity API events for other than provided service work orders.

        Audits: Yes

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support:
        Supported for all the elements except:

          WorkOrderComponent
          WorkOrderActivity
          WorkOrderActivityDtl
          Status
          PersonInfo

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: None

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains details of the work order that was confirmed. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
